Description: Shoulder sherd of East Greek (possibly Chian) pottery oinochoe; exterior: glazed black (fired brown and partly peeling); reserved area at lower break; inscription on exterior. More heavily accreted than most sherds from Naukratis.
Production date: 620BC-580BC (the form of lambda suggests the broad date)
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer published the sherd as probably a South Ionian cup with everted rim but the lack of slip on the interior surface identifies it as a closed shape. There is also a significant amount of incrustation on the interior and exterior surfaces including some that was interpreted as part of a ring foot. The possible white slip beneath the glaze would suggest a Chian origin; if it is slip, not accretion.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 233)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 662, no. 194) (also Bernand p. 717, no. 755)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 114, NAU 74, pl.15n-o)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0043) (phase 2)
